value.title: Face ID for Apple Macs to arrive in a “couple of years”: Gurman
value.excerpt: Apple might just be planning on bringing Face ID system to the Mac. Known Bloomberg journalist Mark Gurman believes that Face ID will be available in Macs within a “couple of years.” Gurman shared this news on the latest edition of his Power On newsletter.

value.title: Galaxy S10 5G update reportedly breaks face recognition
value.excerpt: Samsung has been making good in its promise to roll out Android updates more regularly, even if a bit belatedly. Part of that involves improving its process for integrating and testing those

value.title: Want your unemployment benefits? You may have to submit to facial recognition first
value.excerpt: After being let go from his job as a software quality-assurance engineer in April, Eric Watkins said he filed for unemployment benefits in Colorado. But he hasn't received a penny of the $6,490 he said he was eligible to receive and he's not sure when he will.

value.title: 25 States Are Forcing Face Recognition on People Filing for Unemployment
value.excerpt: State labor departments claim that they're using face recognition identity verification to prevent fraud, but you might want to check out the privacy policy.

value.title: Maharashtra to rollout AI backed facial recognition for online licence test from Aug
value.excerpt: The move is likely to check the proxy candidates appearing for the online learners' licence test in the state.

value.title: Automate annotation of image training data with Amazon Rekognition
value.excerpt: Every machine learning (ML) model demands data to train it. If your model isn’t predicting Titanic survival or iris species, then acquiring a dataset might be one of the most time-consuming parts of your model-building process—second only to data cleaning. value.title: Study: Gene therapy may protect against vision loss from glaucoma, diabetes
value.excerpt: A new form of gene therapy may help prevent vision loss caused by diabetic retinopathy and glaucoma, according to a study published Thursday by the journal Cell.

value.title: Federal Judge Forces Accused Capitol Rioter to Unlock Laptop With Face Recognition
value.excerpt: U.S. courts are split on whether forced device unlocks violate the Fifth Amendment, and the Supreme Court has yet to step in.

value.title: VOCHI raises additional $2.4 million for its computer vision-powered video editing app
value.excerpt: VOCHI, a Belarus-based startup behind a clever computer vision-based video editing app used by online creators, has raised an additional $2.4 million in a “late-seed” round that follows the company’s initial $1.

value.title: AI Image Recognition Market to See Huge Growth by 2026

value.title: Maine’s facial recognition law shows bipartisan support for protecting privacy
value.excerpt: The ACLU urges all Americans to ask their members of Congress to join the movement to halt facial recognition technology and support federal legislation limiting it.

value.title: Plyable Harness The Latest In AI And Computer Vision To Deliver Innovation
value.excerpt: Plyable harness the latest in AI and computer vision to deliver innovation in the manufacturing space - read at TechRound >>

value.title: Researchers disclose vulnerability in Windows Hello facial recognition
value.excerpt: A new research report shows that hackers can get around Windows Hello by using a certain type of hardware and eventually gain access to your PC.

value.title: AWS Computer Vision: Getting Started with GluonCV
value.excerpt: This course covers AWS services and frameworks including Amazon Rekognition, Amazon SageMaker, Amazon SageMaker GroundTruth, and Amazon SageMaker Neo, AWS Deep Learning AMIs via Amazon EC2 ...

value.title: Duke Energy used computer vision and robots to cut costs by $74M
value.excerpt: Duke Energy’s AI journey began because the utility company had a business problem to solve, Duke Energy chief information officer Bonnie Titone told VentureBeat’s head of AI content strategy Hari Sivaraman at the Transform 2021 virtual conference on Thursday.

value.title: Facial Recognition Fail Spurs Bid to Ban It From Police Cameras
value.excerpt: One such lawmaker was Assemblyman Phil Ting, D-San Francisco, was matched with a mug shot by Amazon’s facial recognition software called Rekognition despite never having been arrested. “This is a demonstration that this software is not ready for ...

value.title: Facial Recognition Creates Risks for Trans Individuals, Others
value.excerpt: As more government entities look to adopt facial recognition, concerns have been raised about its potential risks and how the technology might have disproportionate impacts for transgender and nonbinary individuals.

value.title: Black teen kicked out of skating rink after facial recognition error
value.excerpt: Misidentified, accused of brawling and then kicked out of a roller-skating rink -- the case of a young Detroit girl is the latest facial recognition controversy.

value.title: Maine Enacts Toughest Facial Recognition Ban in U.S.
value.excerpt: Augusta, Maine — The Maine State Legislature has passed a bill that will prohibit the use of facial recognition surveillance by certain government employees and officials. While these bans have been popping up more and more over the country, Maine took ...

value.title: Backlash to retail use of facial recognition grows after Michigan teen unfairly kicked out of skating rink
value.excerpt: Apple, Macy's, Albertsons, Lowes and Ace Hardware all use facial recognition software in their stores. Multiple civil rights groups banded together this week to end the use of facial recognition tools by large retailers.

value.title: eBay taps computer vision to transform online shopping
value.excerpt: Bay chief AI officer details how the shopping site's computer vision is driving customer satisfaction with image based search.

value.title: Black Teen Barred From Skating Rink After Facial Recognition Camera Misidentified Her
value.excerpt: A Black teenager's parents are considering taking legal action after she was barred from a skating rink because the venue's facial recognition technology misidentified her. Juliea Robinson dropped off her daughter,

value.title: Smart Cities: How Facial Recognition Can Facilitate The Safe Return To Urban Life
value.excerpt: When deployed correctly and used to its highest potential, facial recognition technology can help facilitate safe interactions and support a flourishing economy.

value.title: Congress Asks Experts for Guidance on Facial Recognition
value.excerpt: Law enforcement uses facial recognition systems with little oversight and, at times, disastrous impact. During a congressional hearing this week, members and experts talked through how new laws could head off greater harm.

value.title: Civil Rights Groups Take Aim at Facial Recognition Tech in Stores
value.excerpt: Three dozen civil rights organizations have called on retailers to stop using the tech, saying “prioritizing profit over privacy is wrong.”

value.title: Report: Computer vision adoption expected to grow significantly in the near future

value.title: Port of Seattle bans facial recognition tech by law enforcement; some private use remains permitted
value.excerpt: The Port of Seattle Commission voted Tuesday to ban the use of biometric technology for surveillance and security purposes by government and law enforcement on all its

value.title: Seedtag’s Computer Vision Capabilities Boost Olympics Brand Sponsorships Within Digital Environment
value.excerpt: Seedtag, the leader in Contextual advertising in EMEA and LATAM, has today announced that it has developed specific computer vision capabilities to detect sports and help advertisers harness the power of visual media throughout the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games.
